title: State Fight: Michigan economic plan emphasizes satellite communications
summary: The Michigan Aerospace Manufacturers Association is working to build Michigan’s space sector through projects like Space Enabled Connectivity for Advanced Mobility or SECAM.

title: State Fight: Shoring up Florida’s Space Coast
summary: The Sunshine State’s efforts to lure commercial space ventures began well before the sun set on the Space Shuttle era.

title: Next SpaceX launch to deploy fewer Starlink satellites into higher orbit
summary: A Falcon 9 rocket set for launch Monday will deploy the SpaceX’s next batch of Starlink internet satellites into a higher, more circular orbit than the last few flights, reducing the potential risk to the satellites from a solar storm like the one that destroyed at least 38 Starlink spacecraft earlier this month.

title: European Union lays out plan to bolster space traffic management capabilities
summary: The European Union is rolling out a new space traffic management initiative to build up its abilities in the field while working with both the United States and the United Nations.

title: Northrop Grumman Sends NASA Science, Cargo to International Space Station
summary: A fresh supply of 8,300 pounds of scientific investigations and cargo launched from NASA’s Wallops Flight Facility in Virginia at 12:40 p.m. EST on Saturday, Feb. 19, aboard a Northrop Grumman Cygnus resupply spacecraft, and is now traveling to the International Space Station.
